data.title: Historic District Savannah Hotel
data.text: Very nice, great location hotel! Friendly staff, nice rooms, nice bar and restaurant. Valet area can be a little tight and busy on weekends, but the valet staff are on the ball and get everyone unloaded and vehicles parked in a timely manner, very impressed with their ability! Beside the concierge, the valet staff are excellent people to ask for recommendations.

data.title: Nice, comfortable, welcoming staff.
data.text: Great place to stay. Valet parking $27/d. Outside parking just as much. Good location for sights and eats . /(:!$.&;)3(/,/?):$&;&;'nfjdhehdnjfkfjndnejdkdkfmmrjfjfmdjfjmfjdkdkfmfmkdkdklslsmemdkfokdkdkdk

data.title: A jewel box in the heart of Savannah!
data.text: I had to be in Savannah for business, and I arrived a day early to enjoy some leisure time.  The hotel was very accommodating to extend my stay - and even offered me the discounted rate my company was paying for my other days. When I checked in, I was told no room was available.  They apologized and said it'd be ready soon - before I could check my bags with the valet, I received a text message that the room was ready! The text messaging service was very cool, and made it feel like you had your own personal  concierge.  The hotel is beautiful and decorated with a modern touch - it looks like a very upscale boutique hotel.  The staff were all amazing.  Special shoutouts to Jamir, the valet; Dana at the front desk, Princess who served me in the restaurant, the friendly concierge, and the gracious night attendant who recommended some sight seeing, and offered me complimentary razor and shave cream.  I'd definitely stay here again - and it is steps away from everywhere you want to be.  Walking distance to River Street, City Market and many great restaurants - including Lady & Sons!

data.title: Quality stay with a few hiccups
data.text:
We are Hilton Honors and booked in advance (and confirmed by the hotel) certain special needs. After 12 hours of traveling, we were exhausted and unfortunately our special health needs were not met. They also did not have on file that we had a breakfast plan.

However, the next day fell into place and we could appreciate the hotel and the excellent location. The rooms with the sofa were a perfect size. The room was clean and modern. The front desk staff and the bell men did everything to compensate for our check-in. Having the concierge available was a nice perk for this type of hotel.

Savannah is a noisy city and the hotel acknowledged the issue in advance with ear plugs and a noise machine that helped immensely. The Internet was sporadic just like home.

Overall a very good stay and would recommend this hotel.

data.title: Outstanding Hotel
data.text: We loved this recently updated hotel. Accommodations were beautiful and staff went above and beyond. Close to eeverything, including the Riverwalk and Market Square. The beds were so comfortable, I could have slept all day.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the excellent review! We are pleased you enjoyed your accommodations and the close proximity of the hotel to both City Market and River Street. We look forward to your next stay with us!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Doubletree Historic District
data.text: stayed for 2 nights recently. recently renovated. excellent location precluded need for car. Valet parking is $27 per night. morning buffet is very nice. evening cocktail hour is well received. a little noisy in the morning.  bus stop for Hop-on Hop-off (white van) is just behind hotel and was very good. many restaurants within walking range as was the riverfront. would stay again.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Steven! Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review of your recent stay. We are pleased you enjoyed the complimentary Pour Hour, featuring our bartender's choice of beer, wine, or cocktails. We are also happy you enjoyed the convenient location of the hotel. We hope you will choose to stay with us again soon. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: DoubleTree Hotel
data.text:
The DoubleTree was a very beautiful Hotel located in a good area in Savannah, Georgia. It was very close to action.
The DoubleTree as I said was beautiful. The rooms as well were very pretty
and comfortable.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review, Dona! We are pleased you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us. We are also pleased you found your accommodations to be pretty and comfortable. We hope to become your preferred hotel for any future travel to Savannah. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great stay on Bay St.
data.text: Excellent hotel, freshly remodeled.  It is in a great location, everything in walking distance.  The lobby was impeccable, the rooms were spotless, and the staff was very friendly.  I will certainly stay here again the next time we are in Savannah!

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you, Chris, for the five star review! We are pleased you enjoyed the convenient location of the hotel and that you found the staff to be so friendly during your stay. We look forward to welcoming you back soon for another fantastic stay. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Weekend Stay for Rock & Roll Marathon
data.text: Let me start out by saying I am Diamond HiltonHonors Member, so this review is from someone who visits quite a few hotels. This hotel is amazing and in a fantastic location and within easy walking distance to all the sites. Staff was very helpful and the hotel kept up very nicely. The breakfast is first class and as is all the hotel staff. Highly recommend staying here and will do so again on my next trip to Savannah.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Billy! Thank you for the excellent review. We are pleased you enjoyed the convenient location of the hotel, as well as the breakfast offered. We appreciate you leaving your recommendation for future guests, and we look forward to your next stay with us!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place to stay
data.text: This place is the best. Staff is great. If you want something just ask. Rooms are very clean. Bar and restaurant are fabulous! Walk out through the front entrance and you are in the historic district. Walls that are thick so you don't hear your neighbors. Definitely above the others.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Hello Kevin! Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review of your recent stay. We are pleased you thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us, and we truly appreciate you sharing your experience with us. We hope you will choose to return soon for another great stay. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Road noise!
data.text:
We spent one night here on a trip from DC to Fort Lauderdale.  They gave us a room facing the main street, and both of us woke up during the night to see if the window had been left open.  Turns the windows do not open--it's just a very noisy place.  Given the restless night, I really felt this was not good value for money.

If you have to stay here, insist on a high floor away from the street.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: David, thank you for your feedback. We would like to apologize for any inconvenience you experienced due to excess outside noise. We would like to let you know that we do offer complimentary ear plugs and white noise machines to assist with a peaceful night's rest. We hope you will allow us an opportunity in the future to provide you with a better stay. Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dont stay here
data.text: First, I am a Diamond HiltonHonors Member, so this review is being done after 15 years of loyalty to Hilton. This is by far the worst Hilton property i have ever experienced. They charged $300 a night and then another $26 valet parking. I booked the room through the Diamond members desk. When arrived at the hotel i was told there were no room upgrades available and that i had the last room available. The room they gave me was located street side and on the second floor, terrible location. The noice from the traffic on this street goes on all night long, non stop, they even have ear plugs in the room so you cant hear the traffic. You think there would be a disclaimer posted on the website or that the diamond desk would let the customer know about the noise issue. Clearly, the property knows it has an issue with noise, the ear plugs on the desk are proof. For $300 a night, this was an outrage. When I complained to the Diamond Desk they sent an inquiry to the hotel desk about the complaint, i did request a full refund. The hotel sent me an email from MR Sikes, Assistant Front Office Manager to apologize about the room selection and parking, never did he address my complaint about not being able to sleep due to the noise outside my room. I replied to Mr Sikes with a follow up email and he never responded back to me. Nice treatment of a Diamond Member! I would recommend avoiding this property at all costs. I will continue to fight for my refund, which it appears neither Hilton or the property seems to care about. Marriott is looking better ever day after 15 years with Hilton.

data.title: Excellent stay!
data.text: The hotel is wonderful.  It's a great location and within easy walking distance of all the sites.  The best part of the stay was the exceptional staff.  Everyone from check in to check out was extremely friendly and accommodating.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the excellent review! We are pleased you enjoyed the convenient location of the hotel, as well as the exceptional service from the staff. We hope you will choose to stay with us again soon. Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Weekend getaway
data.text: We had a hotel reservation for a different hotel, but we were not happy with that hotel.   We found the Doubletree hotel and walked in to see if they had availability. They had a room for us and even gave us and an early check in.  They gave us two water bottles and their famous cookies.  The room was absolutely beautiful and clean.  We had a balcony with great views.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.   Defiantly recommend this hotel.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review of your recent stay! We are pleased you enjoyed the views from your balcony and that you found your accommodations to be clean. We appreciate you leaving your recommendation for other travelers, and we hope to welcome you back soon for another great stay. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfortable peaceful stay
data.text:
The room was very spacious and spotless. Great for a family of 4 with two little girls under 4 years old who wanted to play and move around.
Excellent customer service. 
The valet service was prompt. 
The cookies a nice yummy touch.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the five star review! We are pleased you found your accommodations to be clean and spacious. We are especially happy you enjoyed our signature DoubleTree cookies. We hope you will return soon for another great stay with us. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A good night
data.text:
Stayed for one night, requested a quite part of the hotel and we were given what we asked for. A clean and well looked after Hotel.
Room was excellent , bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your review! We are pleased you enjoyed your accommodations and that you found the hotel to be quiet. We hope to become your hotel of choice in Savannah. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Almost Very Good...But Not Quite
data.text:
There are a few things about this place that are amazing!!  First off, the staff are exceptional.  From Dana at the front desk, to the young men valet parking cars, to the bartender - everyone was nice, friendly and engaging.  

The location of the hotel is perfect.  You are in the heart of the historic district, so within walking distance of tons of restaurants, bars and parks.  Because of this, it can be quite noisy at night.  So if you are a light sleeper, or need to be out of the beaten path, this is not the place for you.  The hotel also spells very good.  In the main lobby and up to our floor they have placed air towers throughout the hotel.  I loved the scent.  

There is a public parking lot across the street from the hotel.  We got lucky - two nights were free for us and the next night we paid the $20 rate.  But it's still cheaper than the hotel's $27/night valet parking. 

The reason I can't give the property a "Very Good" is housekeeping.  They took a shortcut when cleaning the room. When I woke up after the first night, I noticed that the duvet cover had lipstick on it.  So I placed the card on the bed to indicate that I wanted my bed linen replaced.  Later that evening upon returning to the room, I discovered that the lipstick stain was still on the duvet. I called the front desk and got it aken care of.  But it bothered me that if it weren't for the stain, I wouldn't have known that

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your comments. While we are pleased you enjoyed some aspects of your stay with us, we regret to hear you were not completely satisfied. We would like to apologize for the issues you experienced regarding your room being serviced, and we have addressed this issue with our housekeeping team to ensure future guests do not have a similar experience. We hope you will return in the future for a better second experience. Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Horrible experience
data.text: We waited 4 hours for our room to get ready. Having been a hotel manager, I know that they could have asked the housekeeper to clean our room prior to another one. Then concierge left at 5:30. We never had a chance to ask for help.  Balcony was a small triangle with no room for chair! Sleepless night with noise from the streets below.  Never stay here. There are great Hilton hotels but this one needs customer service training. They should have told us about the noise when we booked as a Hilton Honors member.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your feedback. We would like to apologize for the issues you encountered during your stay, particularly the delay in checking into your room. We would like to assure you this type of stay is not at all typical of our hotel. We would also like to apologize for any inconvenience caused by outside excess noise and let you know that we do offer complimentary ear plugs and white noise machines to assist with a peaceful night's rest. We hope to provide you with a better stay in the future. Thank you.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: EXTREMELY COMFORTABLE
data.text: There was ABSOLUTELY nothing to dislike or complain about at this hotel. The check-in process was smooth and handled very capably by Carolyn. The room was great and the ability to really darken the room made for an extremely good night's sleep. The check out process was equally smooth and the bill was perfectly prepared. I HIGHLY recommend that you stay here whenever you need to visit Savannah.

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the outstanding review! We are pleased you thoroughly enjoyed all aspects of your stay with us, particularly the seamless check in. We will be sure to let Carolyn know of your kind words. Thank you for leaving your recommendation for other travelers, and we hope you will choose to stay with us again soon. Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great service!
data.text: The location was a little further from town than expected, but the service was fantastic! Everyone there from the front desk to the restaurant was attentive to our needs and very friendly. A minor problem with the tv remote was handled quickly, and we were rewarded with a gift certificate for dinner for our "inconvenience "---and we never even complained. Definitely they excel in customer service!

owner_response.author: Jackie S, Manager at DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the five star review! We are pleased you enjoyed the excellent service from the staff, and we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience with us. We look forward to your next stay with us!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
